name: BEST WESTERN PLUS Fernie Mountain Lodge

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A most pleasant stay here. Beautiful grounds and helpful staff as well as comfortable room. Breakfast was in a bistro type cafe and had thankfully real eggs on the buffet. We had pizza for dinner from the parlor adjoining the hotel that was also very good.
reviews.title: Beautiful property

reviews.text: We were overnight guests on June 29,2012, enroute from Spokane, WA to Waterton Park in Alberta, Canada. We are senior citizens, were travelling with our grandchildren, age 11 & 8.
reviews.title: enjoyed most of the stay

reviews.text: Our room was of averge size, it was clean. The air conditioner had NO way to adjust where the airflow hit- and it hit the person sleeping near that side of the bed. If we shut the airconditoner off and opened the window- the traffic noise was horrible.
reviews.title: Great Stopover

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.title: A great place to stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Dinner at Boston Pizza (attached and recommended)food was quite good- VERY spendy, and even with half the tables un-occupied, service was very very slow.Took over 20 minutes to get a serving of apple crisp to take back to the room. Would NOT go there again.
reviews.title: Enjoyed our stay

reviews.text: Wow, stayed here 2 years ago, and had very good memories about this place... So I was ready to return to this property. If it wasn't for a business trip, it would have been my first time ever that I would have signed out in no time. The POOR rating is attributed to some of the good people working in this hotel...
reviews.title: 2 Days too many...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Got there, and the Front Desk gentleman told me about a 45 min. running water interruption. I was happy with the info provided (even if not a positive one when you come from a long drive), and even more impressed about the correct time estimated duration. But from here, all went sideways. Not even 2 hours since arrived, one hotel customer storms into the room, apparently being double booked. Checked my key envelope, and notice that my room number was scribbled over another number previously assigned. The same young fellow from Front Desk was already on the corridor tracking down this client and advise him about the confusion. He also presented me his excuses, so really professional approach, but embarrassing for all of us.
reviews.title: Great place for a stay in Fernie

reviews.text: The room, not a happy picture: with the exception of the TV, it was so 2000!!! I turned on the TV, noticed that channels were jumping from 13 to 17, so had no Weather Channel. Called Front Desk, and he told me whatever was on TV available, that was it. He couldn't even confirmed if TWC is one of the channels that should be on the channels menu! Apparently the hotel was not paying for all the channels... But come on, weather and the kids one missing? Really, 2 of the most important ones that a hotel can offer! Looking around in the room, no pen or writing pad to be found, a first for me... In the washroom, at the base of the toilet base, one impressive urine stain. If the next day would have been in Fernie, I would have loved to address all these with a manager. But knew that during business hours I will not be around the town, and for 2 nights at BW FML won't be the end of the world.
reviews.title: Excellent stay

reviews.text: Jumping to the final morning, went downstairs to have Breakfast. I was already unhappy with previous morning's food, where blackened Bacon was served... Got my food & utensils, only to discover that the knife bundled with the fork was way out of this world dirty! Tried another bundle and same disgusting result. Thanks God that the fork was clean... Asked the Kitchen gentleman about getting a straw, and he said to me they do not carry any. 1 day before got one from the same place with the help of the Front Desk, but now... vanished! And the freshness of the bread & pastry products, don't even want to go there.
reviews.title: Clean quiet room with a view! Hot breakfast.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Walked out of the Breakfast Room only to discover that on one of the Floor Area TVs were displaying... The Weather Channel! Talked to FD about this, and she offered to send me a Tech to fix the problem, but I refused saying that I am leaving in less than an hour! And guess who is showing up in less than an hour? The Tech guy... Hopefully he had it fixed for the next ones that got my room.
reviews.title: Everything you need in a hotel!

reviews.text: Stayed in a "Scandanavin Suite". Lots of room, though the decor doesn't remind me of what I saw in Sweden or Denmark. No big deal. Though for almost $250 a noght it was not cheap. Great pool and hot tubs.
reviews.title: OK

reviews.text: The location in central Fernie is nice. I found it loud thought. Between the single pane glass and throught-the-wall a/c units, although we were not on the highway side, trains are loud and horn through every crossing in town.
reviews.title: Nice place!! But don't eat at the Boston Pizza!!

reviews.text: Fernie was our last stop on our way home after a long holiday. 10 days of driving across alberta and saskatchewan had taken its toll and we decided to stop for the night in Fernie. The hotel was the best we had stayed at during our vacation. Nice clean room, comfortable beds, and the hot breakfast was great! One word of advice though, don't order your dinner from the Boston Pizza thats attached to the hotel. Our meal was absolutely terrible!! We called from our room, and were told that it would take an hour and a half to have our meal delivered to our room!! We decided to walk down and pick up our food, which saved us 45 minutes of wait time. I would strongly advise looking elsewhere to find something to eat, I won't be eating at that place again.
reviews.title: Very nice family hotel
Best bed at the end of a long drive.
reviews.text: My daughter, grandson and I stopped on our way through to Nelson, BC and were very pleasantly surprised. Excellent breakfast was included and the pool was great after a long day's drive. the staff ere friendly and the location was good.I would highly reccomend this hotel!

This hotel more than fulfilled my hopes for a comfortable, clean hotel after a long drive. I've always been happy with most Best Western hotels and this one was great. A welcoming reception area and efficient, friendly staff had us into our room in less than two minutes. The suite accommodated my husband and I in two, luxurious queen beds while our teenaged grandson had his own sofabed and, more importantly to him, his own TV. The bathroom was lovely and the shower produced lots of hot water. Our grandson enjoyed a swim in the pool and I noticed a hot tub in the pool area as well. Before checkout we ate a hot breakfast (included in the room price) which was better than many similar offerings in other places. Friendly, helpful staff included the front desk clerks, breakfast room servers, and housekeeping employees. And did I mention the value? Our lovely room and breakfast for three was $149 plus taxes. Only two minor problems: the hair dryer didn't work and we couldn't access the hotel's wireless on our laptop (although we had no difficulty on the iPad and iPhone.) Both of these issues are fixable and staff was already working on the wireless issue when I mentioned the problem. I am definitely looking forward to our next stay at this hotel.
reviews.title: Good stay let down by lousy breakfast

reviews.text: The rooms were wonderful for our traveling party of 6 (kids included). We did have to trek our luggage a long way as the one trolly was being used. The breakast was average but the floors and tables were very dirty. The staff were working hard to clear them and keep food out though. The dinner next door at Boston Pizza was good but the service was extremely slow despite very few customers. Hotel staff were excellent.
reviews.title: Great Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I don't have any great expectations of "one night stop over" hotels. The Fernie Mountain Lodge was actually a pleasant surprise after stays at some much newer Best Western Plus facilities. The room was large and well maintained. Breakfast was actually served on "real" glass and china.
reviews.title: Above Average Best Western

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Not unexpected was dealing with my pet peeve of not being able to regulate the climate in the room without the loud air conditioner blowing icy air directly at the bed. At first I was thankful that the windows opened and we could shut it off. The local competition as to who in Fernie has the loudest jacked-up "super duty" pickup truck, however, soon put a damper on my enthusiasm.
reviews.title: Very nice indeed!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stay in maybe 10 - 15 different BW's a year. Most are very nice but this property is above the rest. The room was great, the mountain view from the room was great, the staff were friendly, but of note - the "complimentary" breakfast was excellent. Also note, the property is very close to the local golf course, which is worth your time.
reviews.title: Nice location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stopped at this hotel for an overnight stay while en route to other places on a road trip. If you are planning a golf or skiing holiday, this hotel is in a perfect location for those activities and for us, it was well situated for a stay just to break up the driving.
reviews.title: Great Place
